name: Detecting Tainted Food Sources
description: Techniques to identify and prevent contamination, poisoning, and nutritional sabotage in food supplies.

cards.title: Identifying Spoiled & Contaminated Foods
cards.description: Recognizing signs of microbial growth, chemical alterations, and toxin presence in food.
cards.bulletpoints: Visual cues, chemical testing, microbial culture methods
cards.summaryText: Scan food for off colors, odors, or textures, back it up with quick chemical strips, and culture suspicious samples before they hit plates.

cards.title: Foodborne Pathogen Detection
cards.description: Testing and identifying bacterial, viral, and fungal contaminants in food sources.
cards.bulletpoints: Listeria, Salmonella, E. coli, mycotoxins detection methods
cards.summaryText: Deploy rapid assays for Listeria, Salmonella, E. coli, and mold toxins so outbreaks get crushed before distribution.

cards.title: Detecting Slow Poisoning & Bio-Accumulation
cards.description: Recognizing symptoms and patterns of slow-acting poisons in food over time.
cards.bulletpoints: Heavy metal testing, synthetic toxin markers, long-term exposure symptoms
cards.summaryText: Track heavy metals and synthetic toxins in tissues and watch for creeping symptoms to expose slow-burn poisoning.
